column1: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) size (128, 256, 1) capture representing the head of a man aged  of 37 years old, with a sequence weighted in T2 and sagittal section, starting from the right hemisphere of the skull. We observe the following characteristics: the brainstem of volume 80.4199 mm³, the white matter of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 5384.1797 mm³, the cortex of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 4404.6387 mm³, the right lateral ventricle of volume 235.9863 mm³, the white matter of right hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 541.8457 mm³, the right cerebellar cortex of volume 1661.1328 mm³, the right thalamus proper of volume 395.5078 mm³, the right caudate nucleus of volume 303.2227 mm³, the right putamen of volume 90.9668 mm³, the right globus pallidus of volume 104.1504 mm³, the right hippocampus of volume 84.3750 mm³, the right amygdala of volume 93.6035 mm³ and the right ventral diencephalon of volume 134.4727 mm³.
